defaultSession.title: What is HTTP?
defaultSession.summary: This course will cover what HTTP is and why is it important. It will also cover small sections of networking and tools to use HTTP without a browser.

defaultSession.title: Intro to Web Development
defaultSession.summary: A web development course that introduces the basic languages, tools, and practices to make your own modern websites.

defaultLesson.title: Introduction
defaultLesson.summary: Discuss what HTTP stands for and the importance it provides to our day to day lives.

body: Websites have been integrated into our daily lives and sometimes we take them for granted. With a few clicks and a couple of seconds, we can gain access to vast amounts of knowledge, entertainment, etc. One common way to visit a website is to type the URL or address of the website into your browser. However, have you ever wondered what the HTTP part at the beginning of the URL is? HTTP stands for hypertext transfer protocol, a standard protocol for the web to exchange information. HTTP provides a set of rules to ensure a set of communication between two parties. This relationship is usually between a client like yourself and a server where the website is located.

HTTP has a ton of methods, the most common HTTP methods are GET, POST, PUT and DELETE. 

- The GET method request information from a server
- The POST method stores information on a server
- The PUT method update information from a server
 - The DELETE method deletes information from a server

quiz.question: What does HTTP stand for?
quiz.feedback: Please refer back to the lesson.

quiz.question: What are the 4 common HTTP methods discussed in the lesson?
quiz.feedback: Please refer back to the lesson.

defaultLesson.title: How does HTTP work?
defaultLesson.summary: Discusses the steps of how HTTP works when we visit a website online.

body: Whenever you want to visit a website online, all you have to do is type the name of the website or URL in your browser, and in one click, you will be shown the requested content. To access the website server, you need the address or IP and port number of the server. To get the IP, the browser will go to a separate server through Domain Name Service (DNS) and find the associate IP of the hostname. Then, the browser will send a request to that IP to retrieve the requested content. The browser handles and hides the back-end communication with the website server you are trying to access.

defaultLesson.title: The Basics and Intro to HTML
defaultLesson.summary: Here we will introduce the basic languages for web development and explore the first language, HTML.

body: A website is a collection of web pages and resources. The content of a page can consist of words, images, videos, and more! Coding allows us to give instructions to the computer to build our website. Computers don't understand regular English, we code websites by using the programming languages Hypertext Markup (HTML), Cascading Stylesheet (CSS), Javascript (JS).
HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language. HTML describes the content and structure of information on a web page.

quiz.question: What does HTML stand for?
quiz.feedback: Please refer back to the lesson.

quiz.question: You developed a website but there were some spelling errors in the text. Now you have to fix the content of the paragraph. Which file should you change?

defaultLesson.title: Intro to CSS
defaultLesson.summary: Learn how to edit and change the style of a webpage.

body: CSS describes the appearance and layout of information on a web page (as opposed to HTML, which describes the content). CSS files (ending with .css) can be linked to HTML files.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of CSS files?
options: Control the behavior of content on the webpage
Change the appearance and layout of a webpage
Communicate with the user how to use the webpage
quiz.feedback: Please refer back to the lesson

defaultLesson.title: Intro to JS
defaultLesson.summary: Now that we know how to add content and styles to a web page, lets explore how to add behavior.

body: Javascript (JS) adds functionality and behavior to websites. This could mean inserting dynamic text into HTML files, reacting to events, performing calculations, and more! Javascript is not the same as Java.

quiz.question: True or False. I can use Javascript to insert dynamic text into HTML.

defaultSurveys.introduced: I found out on my own
